intro: Oenoplea lineata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed daisy, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of white and yellow. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Oenoplea lineata is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to dry, coastal climates. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and resilient member of the Asteraceae family.
